meanings.definition: the quality of being open and honest in expression
meanings.sent1: Her candor in admitting her mistake impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your candor in telling me the truth.
meanings.sent3: His candor about his fear of spiders made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The candor of the child's innocent remarks was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The politician's lack of candor was evident to all.

meanings.definition: sincere and straightforward in speech or behavior
meanings.sent1: She appreciated his candor when he apologized sincerely.
meanings.sent2: Being candid and showing candor is important in relationships.
meanings.sent3: His candor in admitting he ate all the cookies was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The candor of the teacher's feedback helped the students improve.
meanings.sent5: The candor of her smile showed her true feelings.

meanings.definition: the state or quality of being frank, open, and sincere
meanings.sent1: The candor of their friendship was evident in their conversations.
meanings.sent2: His candor in expressing his feelings made her trust him.
meanings.sent3: The candor of the comedian's jokes made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The candor of the artist's brush strokes revealed his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The candor of the book's ending left readers in awe.
